general: Design a 5' UTR with optimal length and GC content to ensure efficient translation initiation
Optimize codon usage based on CHO-specific preferences while maintaining moderate GC content
Include a 3' UTR with appropriate stability elements to ensure mRNA longevity
5UTR: Keep 5' UTR length between 0 and 191 nucleotides
Maintain 5' UTR GC content between 28.6% and 67.1%
Include a strong Kozak consensus sequence (GCCACC) around the start codon
CDS: Target a Codon Adaptation Index (CAI) of approximately 0.56
Maintain GC content at the third codon position (GC3) between 0.0% and 67.4%
3UTR: Design 3' UTR with length between 0 and 1055 nucleotides
Maintain 3' UTR GC content between 28.6% and 42.6%
Include at least one canonical polyadenylation signal (AATAAA) in the 3' UTR
priority: Codon optimization to achieve target CAI
Design a 5' UTR with optimal length and GC content to ensure efficient translation initiation
Optimize codon usage based on CHO-specific preferences while maintaining moderate GC content
Include a 3' UTR with appropriate stability elements to ensure mRNA longevity
Keep 5' UTR length between 0 and 191 nucleotides
